newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Nestle Ivorian coffee plant reopens.
newsitem.headline: Nestle Ivorian coffee plant reopens.

text.p: Nestle reopened it Nescafe soluble coffee factory unit in Ivory Coast on Monday after an explosion there killed one worker and shut production 10 days ago, the plant's managing director said.
"Production started again on Monday," Nestle Ivory Coast Manager Francois Prevot told Reuters, adding that production losses had been minimal.
The explosion, in a subsidiary boiler, had followed a fire at the plant, he said.
Nescafe Cote d'Ivoire processed around 25,000 tonnes of green robusta beans to manufacture about 10,000 tonnes of Nescafe soluble coffee in 1995/96 (Oct-Sept), a spokesman said.
Most of the exports were destined for Greece and Senegal.
A coffee roasting plant on the same site in Abidjan had not been affected.
